Detailed Description

This class represents a "derives" relation between two non-terminals as a NxN matrix of booleans.

The indexes into the matrix correspond to the indexes of the non-terminal in the grammar.

Two non-terminals are equiv if x derives y and y derives x.

bool GrammarLevels::DerivesTable::getClosure (   ) 
 

Calculate one extra step in the transitive closure of a table.

go through all table elements, and if A->B and B->C, then A->C. Thus, the table is updates in-place. Return true if one complete iteration changes anything at all.

Member Data Documentation

vector< vector<bool> > GrammarLevels::DerivesTable::table [private]
 

For simplicity we represent the 2D matrix as a vector of vectors.

Two non-terminal indexes will then yield a bool, indicating the derives relationship.
